Author: tofu_snob
Text: ARFID is extremely difficult to diagnose in children because kids can be very picky eaters without much of a sense of their appetite. Usually you see it diagnosed in children with autism who have severe food preferences that lead to malnourishment.   That being said, I think you should just flat out tell your parents that you don't want to discuss your weight or eating habits as a child. They might not know that their comments are hurtful if they don't know that you have an ED.
